column2: To a very real extent Merckx's five Tour victories, extraordinary in their number, margin and variety as they are, are the least of it.&nbsp
column3: I think a case could be made that Eddy Merckx was the greatest endurance athlete of the 20th century.&nbsp

column1: Sprinter, time trialist, climber, well'ard, he had it all.
column2: His first tour victory came in 1969.&nbsp
column3: Just 24 yrs old he won all the available jerseys, GC, Sprint, KoM, and that awarded to the most combative rider.&nbsp
column4: Had it been available he would also have won the White Jersey traditionally awarded to the highest placed rider younger than 25yrs.&nbsp
column5: This is the only time one rider has won all the available jerseys in a Tour de France.&nbsp
column6: He won the GC with a margin of 17mins 54 seconds.

column1: To quote all his wins is to overwhelm an audience but this man was a spontaneous competitor, fabulously brave and I think most unusually generous.
